captions.text:
BART Rider:"New Zealand."
BART Rider:"Chicago."

BART Rider:"Toronto."
BART Rider:"Toronto."

BART Rider:"Los Angeles."
BART Rider:"India."

BART Rider:"New YorK."
BART Rider:"Korea."
BART Rider:"Washington D.C."

No matter where you're fromÉafter more than
10 years and 31 million passengersÉ BART
SFO is STILL the easiest way to go.

The BART SFO station has now been around a
decade. That's another milestone for the transit

system that spans the Bay area and connects
commuters, and tourists to where they need
to go.

BART is the number one choice for air travelers
taking transit to and from SFO.

Roundtrip to downtown takes about 30 minutes
- same as a cab.

But roundtrip fare on BART is $16.50, versus
roundtrip in a cab that costs at least $100..if
the traffic isn't backed up.

BART Rider:"Cheaper than a taxi."
BART Rider:"It's quick. It's easy. It's inexpensive."

BART Rider:"It's so convenient and easy to
get to."

BART Rider:"Quick and easy - cheap."
BART Rider:BART Rider:"The convenience is
great."

The San Francisco Travel Association says
around 16 million people visit the Bay area

every year.
Strangers in a strange land can always get
help from people like Connie Rainey.

Connie Rainey/Station Agent: "You're going
to board this train here - get some change
first."

Rainey has worked for BART for 43 years.
She, and other station agents are here with
hands-on directions.

BART takes credit and debit cards, and US
currency.

Station agents will help you navigate the
ticket machine.

Connie Rainey/Station Agent:"You going round
trip right - subtract it down to 16 dollars
- hit that button - print your ticket."

MIKE CHACE AND HIS FAMILY ARE FROM LA AND
HAVE NEVER USED BART.
RAINEY WALKS THEM THROUGH IT.

Connie Rainey/Station Agent:"That will get
you into San Francisco and if you're coming

back tomorrow it's still a good ticket.
Take your ticket.In the Middle, to your right.
That's good."

Mike Chace/BART Rider:"This is the first time
- it's a bit confusing, but I find the BART

personnel very helpful.They go beyond the
call of duty to help a newcomer.I am very
happy with the service."

Connie Rainey/Station Agent:"SOMEONE ALWAYS
NEEDS YOUR HELP AT THE AIRPORT ESPECIALLYÉBECAUSE
THEY'RE FOREIGN TO THE BART SYSTEM."

THERE ARE 3 TRACKS AT BART SFO.
ALL TRACKS LEAD TO DOWNTOWN SAN FRANCISCO.

AND IF YOU WANT TO GO SOMEWHERE ELSE...STATION
AGENTS WILL TELL YOU WHERE TO TRANSFER.
LIKE TO RICHMOND.

Connie Rainey/Station Agent:"Get off at San
Bruno and transfer to a Richmond train."
OR PLEASANTON.

Connie Rainey/Station Agent:"Balboa Park.That's
convenient for a transfer point."

OR EVEN TO SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA.
EVEN THOUGH THAT'S NOT PART OF THE BART SYSTEM.

Connie Rainey/Station Agent:"I Direct them
to the Amtrak station which is by the Embarcadero

and they can catch a bus from there take them
to the Emeryville station...and they can catch
Amtrak to Los Angeles."

A PASSENGER THAT TAKES BART SAVES A GALLON
OF GAS TO DOWNTOWN SAN FRANCISCO.

BART Rider:"I just walk and get on. I don't
have to tell the guy where to go or anything
else.It just happens."

And IT JUST HAPPENS THAT 31 MILLON BART SFO
PASSENGERS HAVE DONE A LOT FOR THE ENVIRONMENT

BY USING BART.
THEY KEEP OUR AIR CLEAN.

EVERYDAY BART SFO PASSENGERS PREVENT THE RELEASE
OF 120 TONS OF CARBON DiOXIDE.

THAT'S A BONUS...FOR GETTING TO YOUR DESTINATION
QUICKLYÉCONVENIENTLY AND CHEAPLYÉON BART

SFO.
FOR BART TV?MARK JONES REPORTING.

title: BART SFO - Still the Easiest Way to Go
